alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 29 at 1:55PM PST until December 30 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves up to 25 feet. * WHERE...Coastal Del Norte, Northern Humboldt Coast, Southwestern Humboldt and Mendocino Coast Counties. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 6 AM PST Saturday.. . * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening surfing conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected.
info.instruction: Large breaking waves along the coast will lead to increased wave run-up on beaches with waves topping and washing over large rocks and jetties. These large waves can be erratic and unpredictable. Use extra caution near the surf zone as these large waves will be capable of sweeping people into the frigid and turbulent ocean water. Mariners traversing the bar are urged to exercise extreme caution or stay in port until the threat subsides. Beachcombing is highly discouraged! Please contact the U.S. Coast Guard for information regarding harbor and bar closures.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Del Norte; Mendocino Coast; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt
